cells.content:
# Getting Started with Next.js

Next.js is a React framework that enables server-side rendering, static site generation, and more. It's a great choice for building modern web applications.

## Key Features

- Server-side rendering
- Static site generation
- API routes
- File-based routing
- Built-in CSS and Sass support

## Installation

To create a new Next.js app, run the following command:

```bash
npx create-next-app@latest my-app
cd my-app
npm run dev
```

This will create a new Next.js app in the `my-app` directory and start the development server.

props.title: Important Note
props.description: Make sure you have Node.js 18.17 or later installed on your machine.

cells.content: React components are the building blocks of React applications. They are reusable pieces of code that return React elements describing what should appear on the screen.

props.title: Component Types
props.description: There are two types of components in React
props.content: Functional components and Class components are the two ways to define React components. Functional components are preferred in modern React applications.
props.footer: Learn more in the React documentation
